image.altText: Guy Barnett stands in front of a big painting and smiles.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a new deputy premier, as an early morning meeting of the Liberal Party elects minister Guy Barnett to the role in the wake of Michael Ferguson's departure from the cabinet.

title.children: Guy Barnett elected unopposed as Tasmania's deputy premier

image.altText: Michael Ferguson resignation press conference, 14 October 2024

props.synopsis: One of the most senior members of the Tasmanian Liberal government, Michael Ferguson, has resigned from cabinet in the face of growing scrutiny over the bungled rollout of new Spirit of Tasmania vessels.

title.children: Tasmania's deputy premier resigns from cabinet ahead of no-confidence motion

image.altText: An older photo of two smiling men in open-necked shirts, one young, one older and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: He counts John Howard, the great Liberal survivor, as one of his heroes — but Michael Ferguson must have known there was little he could do to survive what his Tasmanian political opponents had in store for him.

title.children: 'As a former maths teacher, I know the numbers aren't there': Tasmania's deputy premier jumps before he is pushed

image.altText: Photos of a bus station.

props.synopsis: A mayor and Tasmanian government department are at odds over how a bus interchange could be "ticked off" despite not being fit-for-purpose, with the corner too tight for buses to turn.

title.children: Million-dollar bus interchange sitting unused 10 months later after being built too tight for buses to turn

image.altText: A man's hand encloses an orange ball while blood flows from a needle and tube in his forearm.

props.synopsis: Josh Blizzard has a genetic condition called haemochromatosis, where his body absorbs too much iron. The prescribed treatment is to regularly remove blood, and the good news is it's safe for donation.

title.children: Tens of thousands of '100 per cent safe' bags of blood are being binned instead of donated

image.altText: A man in a dark blue coat holds two 3D printed animated seahorses, while smiling.

props.synopsis: It took "so many iterations" to make anatomically correct 3D-printed seahorses, but staff at Tasmania's Seahorse World are hailing the collaboration with a local business as a win for visitors with low vision.

title.children: These tiny figurines took 70 layers of 3D printing, but now, tourists with low vision can touch a seahorse

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new ferry wharf

props.synopsis: A trial passenger service between Hobart and Bellerive has proven so successful that a permanent ferry terminal is being proposed.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Indoor waiting area, bicycle storage part of newly released designs for upgraded Bellerive ferry wharf

image.altText: Dan Houston applauds Port Adelaide fans

props.synopsis: Dan Houston's move to Collingwood is suddenly in jeopardy after the Port Adelaide board stepped in on a proposed deal. Meanwhile, Carlton is poised to move up the draft board. Follow live.

title.children: Port aborts proposed three-way deal sending Dan Houston to Collingwood as Carlton swings huge pick swap

image.altText: A drone that looks like an aeroplane flies through the air.

props.synopsis: Drones have changed the face of modern warfare and are being used from Ukraine to the Middle East, but can Australia keep up with the pace when it comes to its national defence strategy?

title.children: What Australia needs to learn from the drones dominating the Ukraine war

image.altText: Classroom chair knocked over

props.synopsis: Arduous paperwork, surveillance and bullying from management are among the challenges teachers say they face amid a nationwide education staff shortage.

title.children: 'I had a nervous breakdown': Abusive, bullying behaviour behind teaching exodus

image.altText: A streak of white among a purple sky above green grass at night

props.synopsis: The phenomenon is not well understood, and an astrophysicist says it is hard to predict when and where Steve will appear next.

title.children: Photographers looking for Aurora Australis capture mysterious phenomenon Steve instead

image.altText: People vote in Virginia.

props.synopsis: When Americans turn up to the ballot box next month, it could be the tightest election in more than two decades, according to a US politics expert.

title.children: The upcoming US election could be the closest in more than two decades, expert says

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Peter Dutton behind him. Both wear suits and have been digitally altered like you're wearing 3D glasses

props.synopsis: The outcome of two misleading assertions in 2022 reinforces what many in Australia have long suspected — that when it comes to the facts, there is one set of rules for politicians and another for everyone else.

title.children: Labor wants 'fundamental' electoral reform but noticeably absent from its plans are the biggest threats to democracy

image.altText: Sean "Diddy" Combs dressed in a suit and bowtie not smiling

props.synopsis: The latest accusers are among more than 100 other alleged victims who are in the process of taking legal action against the hip hop mogul.

title.children: Six new lawsuits accuse Sean 'Diddy' Combs of assaulting men, women and child

image.altText: A person holds a grey Visa card next to a black EFTPOS payment terminal

props.synopsis: There is an end in sight for consumers getting hit with sneaky surcharges when they pay on card, with the federal government prepared to ban the practice by 2026, promising to give consumers and small businesses "a fair go."

title.children: Debit card surcharges to be scrapped by 2026, government promises

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

props.synopsis: The ACT Bar Council dismisses 10 complaints made about former ACT director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold during his prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Complaints about the conduct of former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold during Bruce Lehrmann trial dismissed

image.altText: Dozens of people put their hands in the air at a concert.

props.synopsis: A legal firm says it is investigating allegations of "deceptive, misleading or unconscionable conduct". The ticketing company says it is not responsible for setting prices.

title.children: Ticketmaster and Live Nation could face class action from music fans over 'dynamic' ticket pricing

image.altText: Oakdale Guest House fire

props.synopsis: Cold case detectives have announced a $500,000 reward for information over a fire at an Ipswich guest house that claimed the lives of five men more than 30 years ago.

title.children: Cold case detectives announce $500,000 reward over 1990 fire that killed five men west of Brisbane

image.altText: Brisbane Roar coach John Aloisi

props.synopsis: John Aloisi believes frustrating the Japanese into submission is one way the Socceroos can end their 15-year wait for a win over the Samurai Blue, and their first in Japan.

title.children: Socceroos look to end 15-year drought over Japan, with a former great backing new coach Popovic

image.altText: An older couple smile, standing in a kitchen holding kitchen utensils over a pot full of food.

props.synopsis: The latest Foodbank Hunger Report has found 3.4 million households across Australia are experiencing food insecurity, with low income earners having to skip meals or eat less because they cannot afford enough food.

title.children: These pensioners feed vulnerable families. They're seeing a disturbing trend that's been echoed in a new hunger report

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sits in a seat thinking while wearing a dark suit.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the death of a British woman from Novichok in 2018 hears allegations Russian President Vladimir Putin approved the delivery of the lethal nerve agent to the UK for the poisoning of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal.

title.children: Ex-Russian spy says Putin authorised 2018 Novichok poisoning attack in England

image.altText: A big shark near a very small boat.

props.synopsis: An angler's close encounter with a 4-metre shark near the popular tourist town of Exmouth in Western Australia has created a flurry of excitement online.

title.children: Four-metre great white shark spotted in 'weirdly fantastic' sighting in WA's north

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian shares follow Wall Street higher, with Telstra in focus as it holds its annual general meeting. See how the day unfolds on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens at record high, Crown fined $2 million

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Merchant service fees are higher in Australia than in some other countries
Overseas arrivals and departures in August
Surcharges set to fire up political debate

image.altText: A historic photo of a house on wheels.

props.synopsis: The nation-building Snowy Hydro scheme came at a huge cost for the people of Old Adaminaby, some of whom are still lamenting their loss more than 65 years later.

title.children: Decades after the government destroyed their town, residents grapple with progress and bitterness

image.altText: A herd of sheep in a dry paddock on a farm.

props.synopsis: The federal government will provide an additional $32 million to help WA's sheep industry transition away from live exports, bringing the total support package to $139 million.

title.children: Backlash from WA farmers after live export ban prompts extra $32 million in federal government help

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The court found the man's BMW convertible was "substantially over-insured" for more than $130,000, when he'd purchased it for $25,000 a year before the incident.

title.children: Driver jailed after staging car crash as part of $130,000 insurance fraud attempt

image.altText: Anonymous woman lies in a bed with heart rate monitor clipped on finger at the Marie Stopes clinic in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Abortion has become a surprise subject of debate in the Queensland election – putting an issue that many Australians might have thought was settled, back on the national agenda.

title.children: Abortion has been legal in Queensland since 2018. Why is it suddenly a subject for debate?

image.altText: Justin Trudeau shaking hands with Narendra Modi.

props.synopsis: Canada and India expel six of each other's diplomats in tit-for-tat moves as part of an escalating dispute over the June 2023 assassination of a Sikh activist in Canada.

title.children: Canada names Indian ambassador as person of interest in Hardeep Singh Nijjar killing

image.altText: Claudia Karvan poses for season three of Take 5 with Zan Rowe at the Pleasure Club, Newtown.

props.synopsis: The Australian actor and TV producer explains how her Bali upbringing, salsa, and a love for Sinéad O'Connor have shaped her career and attitude to life.

title.children: 'The world can break your heart': Claudia Karvan knows things are bleak, but these songs give her hope

image.altText: Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's new Country Liberal Party government is set to lower the age of criminal responsibility, toughen bail laws and give police more powers as part of a suite of law and order reforms before parliament today.

title.children: New NT government to bring an 'enormous' law and order agenda to parliament today

image.altText: A man walks past a bed of flowers outside the entrance to Crown Casino.

props.synopsis: Victoria's gambling regulator says 242 people were able to place bets between October 2023 and May 2024, and attributed the breaches to systemic failures.

title.children: Crown Melbourne fined $2m for allowing hundreds of self-excluded punters to gamble

image.altText: A woman in a yellow hi-vis shirt crouches with her two children on the ground, while smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Wheatbelt town of Moora has been labelled a "childcare desert" as its only centre can hold 20 children. After receiving funding, the centre can now expand to 55 children in 2025.

title.children: Childcare places to more than double in regional WA 'childcare desert'
